intro: Neriacanthus purdieanus, commonly known as the Cape York sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pale blue or purple flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
